metadata.source: E. Waldschmidt: "The Rāṣṭrapālasūtra in Sanskrit Remnants from Central Asia". In:

children.text: ruṣu janapadeṣu caryāṃ caran sthūlakoṣṭhakam anuprāptaḥ / sthūlakoṣṭhake viharati sthū

body.text: aśrauṣuḥ sthūlakoṣṭhīyakā brāhmaṇagṛhapatayo buddho bhagavān ... sthūlakoṣṭhake viharati sthūlakoṣṭhīyake vanaṣaṇḍe /

children.text: Matsumura: (aśrauṣuḥ sthū)lakoṣṭhīy(akā brāhmaṇagṛhapatayo bhagavāṃ kuruṣu janapadeṣu caryāṃ caran sthūlakoṣṭhakam anuprāptaḥ / sthūlakoṣṭhake viharati sthūlakoṣṭhakavanaṣaṇḍe); SHT XI 4568r1: /// kurūṣu ja + + + + + + .. [r]. pūrvavad yāva[t*] sthū[l](a) /// (in the fragment at hand from the repition
ūlakoṣṭhakān niṣkramya yena bhagavāṃs tenopajagmur upetya bhagavatpādau

body.text: SHT XI 4568r2: /// nditvā ekānt(e) nyaṣ[īdan*] ekāṃtaniṣaṃṇāṃ ///
SHT XI 4568r2: /// nditvā ekānt(e) nyaṣ[īdan*] ekāṃtaniṣaṃṇāṃ ///
Matsumura: t(asmiṃ parṣadi saṃniṣaṇṇo); SHT XI 4568r3: /// gṛhapati[pu]tras tasyām eva pariṣadi saṃ # ///

children.text: caryaṃ caritum / yanv ahaṃ keśaśmaśrūṇy avatārya

°ś(aṃka)līkṛtaṃ, restored according to SHT VIII 1874r2; Matsumura: (sukaram) agāra-m-adhyāva(satā e)kāntadh(ava)līkṛtaṃ yā(vajjī)vaṃ kevalaṃ; SHT XI 4568r4: /// m adhyāvasatā ekāṃtaśaṃkalīkṛtaṃ yā # ///; 5 /// gārikāṃ pravrajeyaṃ

body.text: Matsumura: (anekaparyāyeṇa dhārm)y(ā) ka(thayā); SHT XI 4568r5: atha bhagavāṃ sthūlakoṣṭhiya ///

children.text: SHT XI 4568v1: /// patayo bhagavato [bhā]ṣ[ita]m abhinandyānumodya bh(a) ///; SHT V 1896r1: /// .. [śiras](ā) vand[i]tvā (bhaga)v(ato) ///; Matsumura: (gṛhapatiputras tatraivāsthāt)

body.text: SHT V 1896r2: /// (prakrā)[nt]ā(ṃ) sthūlakoṣṭhīya[kā] .. + ///; SHT XI 4568v2: /// kāṃ brāhmaṇagṛhapatiṃ viditvā utthā # ///; SHT V 1896r3: /// (bha)gavantam idam avo(cat* /) ///; SHT XI 4568v3: /// saṃpadaṃ bhikṣubhāvaṃ ca[r]eyam ahaṃ bha # ///; SHT V 1896r4: /// (bra)[h]macaryaṃ anujñāto + + ///

children.text: SHT V 1896r4: anujñāto + + ///; Matsumura: anu(jñāto 'si gṛhapati)putra
na hy āryaputra tathāgatā vā tathāgataśrā
Matsumura: (na hi gṛhapatiputra tathāgatā); SHT XI 4568v4: /// pitṛbhyāṃ prav[r]ājayaṃti vā upasaṃpā[da] # ///; SHT V 1896r5: /// + .. + + pravrā[j](ayanti) + + ///
tathā bhadanta kariṣyāmi yathā mātāpitarau mām anujñāsyataḥ pravrajitum /

Matsumura: (ahaṃ bhadanta tathā kariṣyāmi yathā mātāpitaram anujñāsyati); cf. K. Wille: "Die Śroṇakoṭīkarṇa-Fragmente der Sammlung Pelliot", Studien zur Indologie und Buddhismuskunde, Festgabe des Seminars für Indologie und Buddhismuskunde für Prof. Dr. Heinz Bechert, hg. R. Grünendahl, J.-U. Hartmann, P. Kieffer-Pülz, Bonn 1993 (Indica et Tibetica 22), p. 300: aham āryaKātyāyana tathā kari[ṣyā](mi) yathā māṃ (m)[ā](tāpitarā)v a[n]u[j]ñāsya[ta]ḥ [sv]ā(khy)[ā](te dharmavinaye śraddhayā agā)(A5)(rād anagārikāṃ pravrajituṃ)
tro bhagavatpādau śirasā vanditvā bhagavato 'ntikāt pra
SHT V 1896v1: /// + + .. [bh](a)[g](a)[vatpād](au) + + + ///; SHT XI 4568v5: /// t prakrānta[ḥ]
SHT XI 4568v5: + + + + (p)[āl]o g[ṛ]hapatip[utraḥ s]va ///; SHT V 1896v2: /// (āmantra)yati
ba tāta anujānīdhvaṃ māṃ pravrajiṣyāmi samyag eva śrad
SHT V 1896v3: /// + + [e]kaputrakaḥ pri[y]o + ///; ed.: maraṇe(na) + + + + + + + + + (bhaviṣ)yāmaḥ kuta(ḥ); Matsumura: maraṇe(nāpi tvayā vayam akāmakā vinā bhaviṣ)yāmaḥ; cf. SWTF s.v. vi-yuj
tha ity evaṃ kuśalaṃ nānujñāsyatha adyāgreṇa na

SHT V 1896v4: /// + (a)nujñāsyatha ity evaṃ [ku](śalaṃ) ///; Matsumura: adyāgreṇa na (annam api bhokṣyāmi); cf. SBhV II 5.27f.: tāta saced anujñāsyasīty evaṃ kuśalam; no ced anujñāsyasi, adya na bhokṣye, na pāsyāmīti
dvau trīn yāvat sapta bhaktacchedānām akārṣīt

body.text: SHT V 1896v5: ///(akā)rṣīt* d[v](au) [trīn yā]va[t] ṣa[ḍ a]pi .. ///

children.text: na tvaṃ jānīṣe duḥkhasya duṣkaraṃ brahmacaryaṃ duṣkaraṃ
vastum / ihaiva tvaṃ tāta rāṣṭrapāla niṣadya kāmāṃś ca paribhuṅkṣva

Matsumura: ekatva(m abhiramaṃ durabhi)sa(ṃ)b(o)dhāny; cf. SBhV II 6.13-22: yat khalu tāta kumāra jānīyās, tvaṃ hi sukumāraḥ sukhaiṣī; na tvaṃ jñātā duḥkhasya; duścaraṃ brahmacaryam; duṣkaraṃ prāvivekyaṃ, durabhiramam ekatve, durabhisaṃbudhāny araṇyavanaprasthāni, prāntāni śayanāsanāny adhyāvastum, duḥkham ekākino 'raṇye vāsaḥ; yāvajjīvaṃ te vyāḍamṛgaiḥ saha vastavyam; yāvajjīvaṃ te paradattabhojino bhavitavyam; yāvajjīvaṃ te mānuṣakebhyaḥ kāmebhyaḥ āvaraṇaṃ kartavyam; yāvajjīvaṃ te mānuṣikābhyo ratikrīḍābhya āvaraṇaṃ kartavyam; ehi tvaṃ tāta kumāra ihaiva sthito yauvarājyaṃ kāraya; kāmāṃś ca paribhuṅkṣva; dānāni ca ⟨dehi; puṇyāni ca⟩ kuru
khaiṣī na tvaṃ jānīṣe duḥkhasya pūrvavat* puṇyāni ca
a jānīyās tvaṃ hi sukumāraḥ sukhaiṣī na tvaṃ jānīṣe duḥkhasya pūrvavat puṇyāni ca kuru /
putrasya vayasyakā yena rāṣṭrapālasya gṛhapatiputrasya mātāpitaraṃ te
aṃba tāta anujānīdhvaṃ saumyaṃ rāṣṭrapālaṃ pravrajitum / pravrajyāṃ sace
yā putrasya gatir anyatra mātāpitaram eva /
Matsumura: (anujānīdhvaṃ putraṃ rāṣṭrapālaṃ pravrajitum / kiṃ mṛtena kariṣyatha / sace)d
evam āvāṃ kumārakās tātaṃ rāṣṭrapālam anujānīyāva
Matsumura: (evaṃ vayaṃ kumārakās tātaṃ rāṣṭrapālam anujānāma)ḥ (/) sac(e)t pravraji(tvā uddarśayitavyam /)
sya vayasyakā yena rāṣṭrapālo gṛhapatiputras tenopasaṃkrāntāḥ / upetya rā
rāṣṭrapāla jānīyāḥ / anujñātas tvaṃ mātāpitṛbhyāṃ pravrajitum / pravrāja
Ed. (note 65): Perhaps to be restored: °pitṛbhyām agārād anagārikāṃ pravrajitum; Matsumura: (anujñāto 'si mātāpitṛbhyāṃ / sacet pravrajya uddarśayitavyaṃ /)
atipūtro 'nupūrveṇa kāyasya sthāmaṃ ca balaṃ ca saṃjanayya yena bhagavāṃs teno
ito rāṣṭrapālo gṛhapatiputro bhagavantam idam avocat /
m upasaṃpadaṃ bhikṣubhāvaṃ careyāhaṃ bhagavato 'ntike brahmacarya
ūlakoṣṭhake vihṛtya yena śrāvastī tena caryāṃ prakrāntaḥ / anupūrveṇa caryāṃ carañ śrā

body.text:
Fragment of fourth leaf (SHT IV 412/15); restoration by Matsumura:
r1

children.text: pālasya pitā madhyame dvārasāle muṇḍinam ullekayati
pitāyuṣmantaṃ rāṣṭrapālaṃ dvārasamīpe dṛṣṭvaitad avocat* tair muṇḍakaiḥ śramaṇakair
ir asmākam ekaputrakaḥ priyo manāpaḥ kṣānto 'pratikulo rāṣṭrapālaḥ pravrājayita upasaṃpādayitas teṣāṃ muṇḍakānāṃ śramaṇakānāṃ
Ed.: /// d[dh]āyādaṃ kṛtaṃ; Matsumura: (asmākaṃ kulasya prati)prasrabdhaṃ kṛtaṃ; below ddāyādaṃ Toch. (?) gloss /// [ṣṭ]./[pt]./[st]. se .. .. yāmu$*
nyate athāyuṣmān rāṣṭrapālaḥ svake niveśane ākrośād anyaṃ naiva dānam alabdha.
aḥ tena khalu samayenāyuṣmato rāṣṭrapālasya purāṇajīrṇadāsī paryuṣitaṃ
yitum. āyuṣmān rāṣṭrapālas tāṃ purāṇajīrṇadāsīm adrākṣīt. dṛṣṭvā tāṃ jīrṇadāsīm etad avocat. bhagini sacet paryuṣitāḥ
ra. āryaṃ yāca. atha sā purāṇajīrṇadāsī paryuṣitaṃ pūtikulmāṣaṃ pātra ākirantī āyuṣmato rāṣṭrapālasya hastataś
uptitaś ca nimittaṃ pratyabhijñāyedam avocat. āryaputra kiṃ rāṣṭrapālaḥ. bhagini
sā purāṇajīrṇadāsī śīghraṃśīghraṃ yenāyuṣmato rāṣṭrapālasya mahallakas tenopasaṃkrāntā. upetyāyuṣmato
svāmi jānīyāḥ, saumyo rāṣṭrapālaḥ sthūlakoṣṭhakaṃ ciraprāptaḥ, svaniveśanaṃ
apālasya mahallako vāmahastena keśaṃ saṃnipātayan paṭakam ekanivāsaṃ nivāsayya yenāyuṣmān rāṣṭrapālo tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ
ṣmān rāṣṭrapālaḥ prakārakaṇṭake sthitas taṃ paryuṣitaṃ pūtikulmāṣaṃ paribhuñjati.
Matsumura: (śakaṭeṣv āropayya nadyā) [...] mā te atonid(ānam utpatsyante śoka(paride)vaduḥkhadaurmanasyop(āyā)sā(ḥ)
nāpāś ca tadrūpaiḥ snātraiḥ snātāḥ vastraiḥ prāvṛtāḥ alaṃkāreṇā
yā dvitīye nipatitvā evaṃ vadata / kathaṃrūpās tā aps
bhū⟨va⟩n manāpāś ca tadrūpaiḥ snānaiḥ snātāḥ pūrvavad yāvac cūrṇair ava
ūpās tā apsaraso yāsām arthe āryaputro bhaga
Matsumura; rāṣṭrap(āla)sya / ⟨pūrve⟩ ā(gāri)kasy(a) ... dvit(ī)yā dvitīye ev(aṃ kathaṃr)ūpās
parityaktaṃ kiṃ na dīyate kiṃ viheṭhīyat
Matsumura: aṃ(ba tāta saced annaṃ) parityaktaṃ kiṃ na dīyate kiṃ viheṭhīyat(e parityakte)
aṇītena khādanīyabhojanīyena svahastaṃ santarpayanti saṃpravārayanti. anekaparyāyeṇa śucinā praṇītena khādanīyabhojanīyena svahastaṃ santarpayitvā saṃpravārayitvā
āyuṣmantaṃ rāṣṭrapālaṃ bhuktavantaṃ viditvā dhautahastam apanītapātraṃ nīcatarakam āsanaṃ gṛhītvā niṣaṇṇā dharmaśravaṇāya
athāyuṣmān rāṣṭrapālas tasyāṃ velāyāṃ gāthā babhāṣe.
Restored text by Matsumura; cf. SHT III 804a r3 (and additions in SHT VII)
